text: Raw as Fuck is an album by the British electronic music group Freestylers. Released in July 2004, it was the group's third album. It is also the first full-length album release from the Against the Grain label.Raw As F**k at Discogs The remix album was released almost a year later.Raw As F**k (Remixed) at Discogs The album included breakbeat dance music, with tracks including the singles "Get a Life", "Push Up" and "Boom Blast". "Push Up" was particularly successful in Australia as a single, where it reached No. 2 in the charts, although in both Australia and the United Kingdom the album failed to make a major impact on the album charts. The tracks "Punks", "The Slammer" and "No Replica" were originally from the singles the Freestylers created as Raw As F**k in 2002–2003.Freestylers Singles/EPs The three singles were their first ever productions in Against the Grain.Against The Grain at Discogs Despite the album's title, the album did not carry an "Parental Advisory – Explicit Content" warning due to a lack of substantial profanity on the tracks themselves. ==Track listing== *Track 5 was originally from "The Slammer" / "Theme From Raw" single by Raw As F**kPunks / Demon Beats *Track 7 was originally from the "Punks" / "Demon Beats" single by Raw As F**kThe Slammer / Theme From Raw *Track 11 was originally credited as Million Dan vs. Raw As F**kNo Replica *The duration of tracks 6 & 11 are extended in US releases.Raw As F**k by Freestylers – Music – iTunes ==Charts== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" ! scope="col"| Chart (2004) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- ! scope="row"| Australian Albums (ARIA) | style="text- align:center;"| 66 |- |- |- |- ! scope="row"| UK Albums (OCC) | style="text- align:center;"| 130 |} ==References== Category:Freestylers albums Category:2004 albums
title: Raw as F**k
